result.execSummary:
The defendant Brady J. Palmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant advised to submit DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Denying Defendant's Motion for Post-Conviction Relief
From Attorney Franker to Judge Goodman (faxed to Judge today)
Letter to Judge Goodman
time for the trial court to decide the defendant's pending postconviction motion is extended to 8/28/17.
Post-conviction motion hearing July 25, 2017
State's letter to the court
to court of appeals, Motion for extension of time to preserve jurisdiction while circuit court prepares its Machner hearing ruling
1 - DA's Seating Chart (0rdered sealed)
1 - DA's Jury Seating Chart

Defendant appears in person with counsel David Franker.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Motion for postconviction relief due to ineffective counsel at jury trial.  Court makes statement to parties.  Will first examine 2nd prong of the issue regarding Strickland.  Defense calls witness, D.A.W., sworn, testifies.  Witness ID's defendant.  Attorney Franker approaches the witness and uses transcript from the jury trial to refresh witness's memory.  Court makes note the transcript is already part of the file and does not need to be entered as an exhibit.  Judicial notice taken of names listed in transcript of the jurors selected by clerk announcing their names and they were to stand.  DA Fox marks Exhibit 1 - DA's trial seating chart - requests to be received under seal.  No objection by defense.  Court grants request to seal Exhibit 1, with such exhibit being available to Court of Appeals if needed.  DA Fox cross-examines the witness.  Exhibit is offered/received under seal but is to be available to Court of Appeals.  Re-direct by defense.  Re-cross by DA Fox.  Witness steps down and is to remain.  Defendant is sworn, testifies.  Court makes statement citing Strickland referencing Justice Sandra Day O'Connor.  Attorney Franker responds to the Court stating the selection process was tainted and affects the fairness of the proceedings.  DA Fox does not cross-examine the witness.  No further evidence to be presented.  Court states he is at the end of his 60 day time limit which is around August 1.  Court states there were certain errors made but is wether it caused prejudice in this case.  Defense will motion the Court of Appeals for additional time for the Judge to make a decision.  Attorney Franker will motion for additional 30 days after the current deadline.  Court directs defense counsel to not release Exhibit 1 as it is under seal.  Counsel will both file letters to the Court.
Copy sent to M.M. at Judge Goodman's office.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss for Attorney Wilson.  Attorney Wilson no longer works for SPD.  Defendant questioned Attorney Poss on his relationship with the DA.  Attorney Poss believes he can represent the defendant in this case.  DA Fox made a statement regarding the relationship.  DA Fox recommended: 1 year probation.  CC.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Attorney Poss recommending $50.00, plus costs on each count with a payment plan.  Defendant asks for a stay of the sentencing.  Court ordered:  $100.00 fine, plus costs on one count.  Court costs on other count only.  No DNA surcharge ordered.  Add 14FO293 to the payment plan.  $50/mo starting 10/1.  Defendant does not want to give DNA sample.  Ordered.
of sentencing notice of hearing.  RTS.  Attempted - Not known.  UTF
2 Guilty Verdicts - 1 for Count 1 & 1 for Count 2
Preliminary Instructions
#1 - Officer's Narrative Report
1 - Officer's Narrative (only used to refresh memory - not offerred or admitted)

Hearing in chambers prior to jury trial.   Defendant has not arrived.  Attorney Wilson waived defendant's appearance.  Motions in limine discussed.  Defendant arrived late.  Frye inquiry done.  Court found that the defendant knowingly, intelligently, voluntarily and freely declined the State's offer of settlement.  In court:  voir dire begins at 9:23 a.m.  Clerk swears in entire jury panel.  Judge begins voir dire.  Entire panel out at 10:36, DA Fox addresses how defense took all of his strikes at once.  Judge instructs clerk to re-print list for peremptory challenges.  Jury back in and on record at 10:48 and strikes resumed prior to going back on the record.  Jury selected and sworn at 10:55.  Short break for jurors to make calls.  Back on record at 11:05 and Judge begins preliminary instructions.  Opening statements begin at 11:22 and end at 11:29.  State calls first witness, C. P. sworn, and testifies.  Record reflects ID of defendant.  He was there to help put up fire alarms at his grandmother's hotel.  Officer James responded.  Witness also received a disorderly conduct citation due to the event.  We both went outside and were separated by the officer.  Witness states he gave statement of what happened to the officer.  Observed Officer James interview Brady.  He put witness in a head lock - he was angry, didn't want me there.  Witnessed officers interviewing defendant - raised voice of brother, animated movements.  Officer James did not act inappropriately and didn't treat him any differently than he had treated himself.  Cross-examination by defense.  Witness states he made an effort to contact SPDO yesterday but no contact with defense prior to today.  He met with prosecutor yesterday.  Re-direct by the State.  No re-cross.  Witness is released from subpoena.  Will break for lunch.  Court admonishses jurors to not discuss or research the case during break.  Adjourned to 1:00.  Reconvene at 1:04.  State calls next witness, J.J., sworn, testifies.  July 15, 2015 - dispatched to E & F Hotel for fight between 2 brothers.  States what he observed when he arrived and who he made contact with.  Located in City of BRF, Jackson County, WI.  Separated the two and made contact with C.P. first; he was cooperative.  Issued C.P. a DC citation as felt he contributed to the situation by arguing and pushing each other.  Principle aggressor was the defendant.  States how he determined that.  Phone was located in office of E & F Hotel.  Made contact with defendant next to deputy's squad.  Explained how he interviewed parties.  Defendant seemed very aggitated and raised his voice numerous times.  States what defendant said to him.  Defendant told officer that he couldn't pat him down.  After asking to pat him down for location of cell phone he pulled his shorts and t-shirt off.  Very strange reaction.  No body cameras at that time.  Filed a narrative report which was put into evidence.  Observed that he didn't have the phone.  Defendant handed him the shorts to search them.  He states he didn't and handed them back to him.  He had continued to be aggitated or further actions would be taken, continued raising voice.  Reached for handcuffs and he took off.  States he knew no one could catch him on foot as he is an avid runner.  Told deputy to not chase after him and advised dispatch he left on foot.  Multiple officers attempted to locate him.  No other officer on duty for City of BRF.  Did not find defendant that evening.  Deputy T.G. was a cover officer at the scene.  Witness explains what that means.  Witness ID's the defendant - record reflects ID.  Cross-examination by defense.  Witness reviews his report to refresh his memory.  SPD Wilson continues with cross.  Witness again uses report to refresh his memory.  Questioning continues.  Re-direct by DA Fox.  Questioned about de-escalation techniques which the witness used during the incident.  Defendant stands up and says he needs to dismiss his attorney as he's not asking critical questions.  Jury out.  Judge questions defendant and addresses him regarding the representation by his attorney and the dangers of representing himself at this point.  Will take a break for the defendant and his counsel to have a discussion in private.  DA Fox has the officer's narrative report marked as an exhibit - Exhibit 1, but is not offered as evidence.  Back on record & all parties except jury present - will proceed with attorney Wilson representing the defendant.  Judge warns defendant about not having outbursts if he needs to talk to his attorney about something.  Jury back and SPD Wilson continues questioning witness.  Witness uses his report to refresh him memory regarding when he completed his report - on July 17.  Witness knew they were brothers prior to being dispatched from past profeesional contacts.  Further questioning by DA Fox.  No further questions. The state rests.  Jury out.  SPD Wilson states his client will testify.  Judge performs colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify or not testify.  He chooses to testify.  SPD Wilson has discussed this right with his client.  Court finds the defendant understands his rights, no threats, or promises, and has had sufficient time to discuss with attorney.  Court accepts his decision to testify.  Witness J.J. is to remain under his subpoena.  Jury back in.  Defense calls the defendant to testify, sworn, testifies.  Describes his grandmother's residence/hotel.  Gave up his apartment to stay with her.  States what his employment history was/is now.  His brother was present but smoke alarms were not repaired.  They argued about soliciting money from grandmother.  He started in about phone and he came after me.  They don't get along very well.  He attacked defendant to get police involved.  Objection - Court orders to strike testimony about criminal record.  I never had the phone.  Grandmother found it and the contact was not in the office.  There was a guest present in the hotel.  Explains how law enforcement was called.  We were questioned by officers at the same time.  I gave Officer James my cell phone after he asked for Casey's phone.  I gave the officer my shorts to check instead of letting him pat me down.  Put clothing back on when told to.  Did not curse or scream at officers.  Told him not to waive his finger in my face and that's when the handcuffs came out.  I protested because I know the constitution and sites several constitutional rights.  Officer James never said he would arrest if he continued to protest.  Doesn't remember officer saying, "calm down or I'll take further action."  I left because I had to get to work.  Then I got chased so I never made it to work.  Didn't feel I'd done anything wrong.  DA Fox cross-examines witness.  DA moves to strike the defendant's testimony.  Jury out.  DA Fox - can't invoke his right to self-incrimination since he decided to testify.  Judge has reporter read back the question he "Plead the 5th".  Attorney Wilson and his client go out to have a short discussion.  Back on the record.  Judge discusses some of the jury instructions at this point regarding impeachment of the witness.  Attorney Wilson states they are prepared to proceed.  Jury back in and cross continues by DA Fox.  Aware it was interaction with a police officer.  Doesn't remember raising his voice or being told to calm down repeatedly because "I didn't do it".  Objected that the officer told me I wasn't going to work.  Defendant states he has recordings of interactions between himself and his brother and with Officer James.  Objection by defense and request to have sidebar or be hearing outside of jury.  Jury out.  Reporter reads back question by DA Fox regarding recordings.  DA Fox states it is attorney/client privilege regarding discussions.  Court finds he opened the door by saying he had recordings.  SPD Wilson states DA Fox was asking if he'd shared that information with his attorney which is attorney/client privilege.  DA Fox states his argument.  Court finds he partially over-rules the objection.  He put it out there that there are recordings but his discussion with Mr. Wilson is protected.  Defendant makes statement to the Court.  Court states he's made his ruling. Jury back in.  DA Fox continues with questioning.  Defendant states he has several recordings of interactions with Officer James.  States he wasn't allowed to present such evidence to DA.  DA Fox states that's for his protection.  No re-direct.  No other witnesses for defense and no rebuttal witnesses.  Officer James is released from his subpoena.  Jury out.  Judge and counsel have jury instruction conference.  Verdict forms acceptable as is by both counsel.  Break while changes made by J.A.  Back on record with jury still out.  Both counsel agree the instructions and forms of the verdict are approved.  Jury back in.  Judge begins closing instructions at 3:08.  Closing arguments begin at 3:25 and end at 3:40.  Judge completes jury instructions.  Bailiffs are sworn in.  Jury alternate named and excused.  Jury out to deliberate at 4:45.  Exhibit 1 is made part of the record but was not offerred or received.  Jury notifies they have a verdict at 4:15.  Jury in and back on the record at 4:20.  Verdict is guilty on Count 1; verdict of guilty on Count 2.  All 12 jurors polled as to their verdict; all answered yes that those are their verdicts.  Judge meets with jurors.  Back on record at 4:36.  Sentencing will be scheduled by J.A.  State moves for judgment on verdict.  Court finds guilty of both counts.  Bond will continue.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on Officer J.J. to appear at jury trial on 8/17.
State's

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Wilson.  Held by telephone, Judge Goodman and Attorney Wilson by telephone from the Monroe County Courthouse.  Motion in Limine filed by defense.  State had no objection.  3 strikes each.  Attorneys and defendant to meet in chambers the morning of trial at 8:30 am.
Defendant's Motions in Limine and Notice of Motions
No violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly contact with:  his brother C.P.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Wilson.  State argued that the complaint is sufficient.  Attorney Wilson made oral argument to dismiss the complaint.  Defendant appeared.  Court questioned Attorney Wilson regarding the charge of disorderly conduct in the complaint.  Why not a basis for disorderly conduct?  Attorney Wilson responded.  Attorney Fox responded.  Attorney Wilson responded.  Attorney Wilson requested the complaint be dismissed.  Court denied the motion to dismiss the complaint.
Motion Hearing on June 17, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.
Defendant's

Attorney David Alexander Wilson in court by authorization.  Gerald Roger Fox appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests the case be set for trial.  Will be set for a 1-day jury trial and final pretrial.  All motions need to be heard at the FPT.  J.A. will schedule.
Pre-trial conference at 01-13-2016 10:00 am

Defendant appears with counsel SPD David Wilson.  DA Fox appears for the State.  Demand for Discovery filed by defense prior to this initial appearance.  Waives reading of the complaint.  Court reviews the charges/penalties.  Defense states his client stands mute.  Court enters NGP, sets PTC for 1-13-16.  Status to be set by counsel calling judical assistant.  Bond continues.
